definition: called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
variant of 秤[cheng4]/steelyard
to weigh/to state/to name/name/appellation/to praise
to fit/balanced/suitable
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
collectively known as/to call sth as a group

sentences.english: The branch or bud that is grafted is called the scion.
sentences.chinese: 嫁接上去的枝或芽被称为接穗。

sentences.english: In Nigeria's press, Cecilia Ibru is referred to as the First Lady of Banking.
sentences.chinese: 在尼日利亚新闻界，伊布鲁被称为银行界第一夫人。

sentences.english: MSG also known as MSG by flavor agent, a white crystal-like.
sentences.chinese: 味精也称为味精增味剂，呈白色晶体状。

sentences.english: Such machines are called space rockets.
sentences.chinese: 这种机器就称为宇宙火箭。

sentences.english: Their drug of choice was a potent intoxicant they called hashish.
sentences.chinese: 他们选择的是一种他们称为“黑煞”的烈性麻醉剂。

sentences.english: It is also named green architecture of city cave-house.
sentences.chinese: 这种建筑也可称为“城市窑洞”式绿色建筑。

sentences.english: These waves are known as the thickest waves in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这些波被称为世界上最厚波。

sentences.english: Packets in the IP layer are called datagrams.
sentences.chinese: IP层中的数据包称为“数据报”。

sentences.english: The film is an American version of a two thousand eight French thriller called "Pour Elle."
sentences.chinese: 这部电影是一个二千八法语称为“倒艾莉。”

sentences.english: Hence, this road is also known as the Path of Lilac.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这条路也被称为路径的淡紫色。

sentences.english: Around the 4th century AD, the site of the Oita city was once called "Bungo".
sentences.chinese: 大约在公元4世纪，大分市所在地域便被称为丰后国。

sentences.english: Judge-made law is called common law.
sentences.chinese: 法官造法就被称为普通法。

sentences.english: This black metal plate is called a collector.
sentences.chinese: 这块黑色金属板被称为集热器。

sentences.english: Light the degree of coloring for object is called color rendering.
sentences.chinese: 光源对于物体颜色呈现的程度称为显色性。

sentences.english: "She is what I would call a fine-looking woman, " I said, after a judicial pause.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个我会称为长相好看的女人。

sentences.english: Ignorance and confidence can truly be a winning combination.
sentences.chinese: 无知和自信真的可以称为一个成功的组合。

definition: to be called/to be known as
to label/to call
also known as
to jokingly call/jocular appellation
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
to be called/to be known as
to call/to be called
to dub with a nice-sounding appellation/fanciful moniker
publicly known (to be)/accepted (as)
to be collectively called/collective term/general designation
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
to elect as/to choose as/to consider as
to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
to have/to have always had
fame/good reputation/famous for sth
to look upon as/to regard as
